III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12203 – Financial Stability
Section
Description (1) An agency shall initially and annually develop and implement a
plan of financing for the operation of the agency in carrying out its
programs and meeting the requirements for licensing. A plan of
financing shall include all of the following:
(a) A listing of all income sources and the anticipated amount of
income for the current fiscal year.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Financial audit from 2022 indicated financial health of the agency
was in decline that could potentially effect the provision of
appropriate services.
Investigation I interviewed the Chief Administrator by telephone on 06/27/2023.
The Chief Administrator reported the excessive expenditures were
related to recruitment/hiring expenses for new staff due to staff
turnover, utility upgrades and building improvements and
maintenance expenses. He also reported a lower census count
for a period of time due to the need to recruit/hire new staff to
handle the census count within required ratios.
I requested the Chief Administrator send me financial
revenue/expenses information for the last 6 months for review. I
sent an email to the Chief Administrator on 7/05/2023 repeating
the request for the financial information. The information was
submitted to me the following day on 07/06/2023. The financial
information submitted indicated the agency had incoming revenue
for the time period of January thru June 2023 that was in excess
of the reported expenses.
Analysis The financial information submitted indicated the agency had an
excess of revenue over expenses for the time period of January
thru June 2023. There was also no evidence reported that the
agency did not have adequate finances to support the program
services being provided. Should information become available to
indicate that financial inadequacies are impacting the youth in
care this investigation will be re-opened.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
